project.teaser: "The Catalan European Researchers Night (#NitRecerCat) project consists in a two years proposal for 2022 and 2023 centered on two main activities: The European Researchers Night (ERN) and Researchers at Schools (R@S). The well-known ERN will be held on September 30th 2022 and...
project.objective: "The Catalan European Researchers Night (#NitRecerCat) project consists in a two years proposal for 2022 and 2023 centered on two main activities: The European Researchers Night (ERN) and Researchers at Schools (R@S). The well-known ERN will be held on September 30th 2022 and 29th 2023. During these two years, eight different partners will bring research and researcher closer to more than 30000 people and 10000. A part of ERN, the present proposal also includes the Researchers at Schools (R@S), which adds a much better and longer interaction of pupils with the research from the Catalan institutions. 15 schools (and near 4000 students) will become #NitEduCat Schools, with two-years of stable collaboration between a team of researchers and the schools (primary and secondary). The will focus on making the general public aware about the present mission-oriented program of European Commission (EU), mainly in the idea of how Researchers can help to change the world (Researchers for Change). #NitRecerCat is divided in two main activities spread throughout the Catalan territory: o Catalan European Researchers Night (Nit Europea de la Recerca, ERN) La Recerca va a lEscola During Friday morning, researchers are going to schools to show their research and vice versa. La Nit Catalana de la Recerca Friday evening/night main activity. Women in Science based on the exhibition Cientfiques Catalanes 2.0 will be shown in all the locations and venues (online). Esopegat amb la Recerca During Saturday morning, research will be found in everyday locations, from markets, to museums, malls, etc, o Researchers at School (R@S) NitEduCat Schools Going beyond single dissemination activities, this part of the project aims to develop 15- medium-long-term projects that promote stable collaboration between a team of researchers and primary/secondary school. Researchers visiting schools During the whole year, many activities will be addressed to students"
project.title: "#NitRecercat: La Nit Europea de la Recerca"
project.keywords: Research Communication, Scientific Education, Scientific Method, Scientific Culture, Public Engagement, Workshops, Divulgative talks

article.title: Bringing researchers and the public together in Catalonia

result.title: "Activities #NitRecerCat 2022"
result.description: Reporting activities of NitRecerCat list participation most successful activities possible lessons learnt delivered 30 days after the Night celebration They will includeoA complete list of the researchers funded under FP7Horizon 2020Horizon Europe with a specific focus on the Marie SkodowskaCurie fellows involved in the event with name surname and projects grant agreement numberoPromotionalaudiovisual material such as conferences leaflets posters videos to be potentially used by the European Commission for promotionalcommunication purposesoWith lessons learnt will help to improve the 2023 editionoFurthermore a disclaimer will be visible at the entrance of the event in the national language of the event

result.title: "#NitEduCat Schools 2023"
result.description: Report on:T.8.1 which will gather videos of the activities done in each school, workshop co-creation materials for research projects (projects (this material may be used in the future by other teams of researchers who want to carry out research projects with schools), and videos of the presentations of the 15 projects in the final seminar. T.8.2 that will gather a list of activities offered to the schools, number of schools, number of students and pictures and videos related to the activities. P1, coordinating the project will be in charge of collecting and reporting the data.

result.title: Awarness Campaign 2023
result.description: Report on the awareness campaign (actions, media feedback, activities on the Internet such as hits on websites, blogs, social networks, etc.), accompanied by samples of promotional material (posters, leaflets, programs, gadgets…) together with pictures and video 30 days after both the event.

result.title: Impact Assessment 2022
result.description: A report on impact assessment after the 2022 European Researchers Night celebration and Researchers at School first year edition M12 It will be related to both WP2 and WP3 It will include the analysis of the different inputs 1 quantitative and qualitative information of attendees 2 media coverage and website impact 3 activity and engagement of social networks 4 Schools participation and researchers It will be accompanied by samples of questionnairesinterviews in English

result.title: Awareness Campaign 2022
result.description: Report on the awareness campaign actions media feedback activities on the Internet such as hits on websites blogs social networks etc accompanied by samples of promotional material posters leaflets programs gadgets together with pictures and video 30 days after both the event

result.title: Activities NitRecerCat 2023
result.description: "Reporting activities of #NitRecerCat (list, participation, most successful activities possible lessons learnt…) delivered 30 days after the Night celebration. They will include:oA complete list of the researchers funded under FP7/Horizon 2020/Horizon Europe, with a specific focus on the Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellows, involved in the event with name, surname and project's grant agreement number;oPromotional/audio-visual material such as: conferences, leaflets, posters, videos to be potentially used by the European Commission for promotional/communication purposes.oFurthermore, a disclaimer will be visible at the entrance of the event in the national language of the event."

result.title: Management report 2022
result.description: Management reports at the end of the first year

result.title: Management Reports 2023
result.description: A management reports at the end of the second year.

result.title: Impact Assessment 2023
result.description: "Report on impact assessment after the 2023 edition as well as Researchers at School activities will be delivered at the end of the year, related to WP6 Impact 2023. It will include the analysis of the different inputs: 1) quantitative and qualitative information of attendees; 2) media coverage and website impact; 3) activity and engagement of social networks; 4) Schools participation and researchers 5) Attendance at each #NitEduCat within the neighbourhood It will be accompanied by samples of questionnaires/interviews in English"

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
